touristplaces.name: Qutub Minar
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1192 by Qutb-ud-din Aibak
touristplaces.specialty: Tallest brick minaret in the world, UNESCO World Heritage Site

touristplaces.name: India Gate
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1931 as a war memorial for Indian soldiers
touristplaces.specialty: Iconic landmark, eternal flame honors fallen soldiers

touristplaces.name: Red Fort
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1648 by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan
touristplaces.specialty: UNESCO World Heritage Site, hosts Independence Day celebrations

touristplaces.name: Lotus Temple
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1986 as a Bahá'í House of Worship
touristplaces.specialty: Lotus-shaped structure, known for meditation and spiritual serenity

touristplaces.name: Humayun's Tomb
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1570 by Empress Bega Begum
touristplaces.specialty: First garden tomb in India, inspiration for Taj Mahal

touristplaces.name: Charminar
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1591 by Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah
touristplaces.specialty: Iconic Indo-Islamic structure, known for its four grand arches and minarets

touristplaces.name: Golconda Fort
touristplaces.origin: Originally built in the 12th century by the Kakatiya dynasty, expanded by the Qutb Shahi rulers
touristplaces.specialty: Massive fort known for its acoustics, architecture, and history of diamonds like the Kohinoor

touristplaces.name: Birla Mandir
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1976 by the Birla Foundation
touristplaces.specialty: White marble temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, offering panoramic views of the city

touristplaces.name: Sundarbans National Park
touristplaces.origin: UNESCO World Heritage Site, established in 1984
touristplaces.specialty: Largest mangrove forest, home to the Royal Bengal Tiger

touristplaces.name: Indian Museum
touristplaces.origin: Founded in 1814, the oldest museum in India
touristplaces.specialty: Has a vast collection of antiques, fossils, Mughal paintings, and Egyptian mummies

touristplaces.name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1855 by Rani Rashmoni
touristplaces.specialty: Famous Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kali, associated with Ramakrishna Paramahamsa

touristplaces.name: Eden Gardens
touristplaces.origin: Established in 1864
touristplaces.specialty: One of the largest cricket stadiums in the world, known for historic matches

touristplaces.name: Kailasagiri
touristplaces.origin: A hilltop park developed for tourism in 2003
touristplaces.specialty: Offers panoramic views of the city, beaches, and the Bay of Bengal; a popular spot for picnics and cable car rides

touristplaces.name: Rishikonda Beach
touristplaces.origin: Natural beach with clean, golden sand
touristplaces.specialty: Famous for water sports like jet skiing, and a serene getaway with less crowded areas

touristplaces.name: Submarine Museum (INS Kurusura)
touristplaces.origin: The submarine was decommissioned in 2001 and turned into a museum
touristplaces.specialty: A unique museum housed in an actual submarine; offers a glimpse into the life of sailors aboard a submarine

touristplaces.name: Simhachalam Temple
touristplaces.origin: Dating back to the 11th century, dedicated to Lord Narasimha
touristplaces.specialty: A stunning blend of Chola and Eastern Ganga architectural styles, considered one of the most revered temples in the region

touristplaces.name: Borra Caves
touristplaces.origin: Formed over millions of years, discovered in 1807
touristplaces.specialty: Exquisite limestone caves with stalactites and stalagmites formations

touristplaces.name: Araku Valley
touristplaces.origin: A scenic hill station located 120 km from Visakhapatnam
touristplaces.specialty: Known for coffee plantations, scenic views, and pleasant weather

touristplaces.name: Alleppey Backwaters
touristplaces.origin: A network of canals, rivers, and lakes in the region
touristplaces.specialty: Famous for houseboat cruises and lush green landscapes

touristplaces.name: Munnar
touristplaces.origin: A hill station known for its tea gardens
touristplaces.specialty: Famous for scenic landscapes, tea plantations, Eravikulam National Park, and the Anamudi Peak

touristplaces.name: Fort Kochi
touristplaces.origin: Historical part of Kochi, with colonial influences
touristplaces.specialty: Known for its Chinese fishing nets, colonial architecture, St. Francis Church, and vibrant art scene

touristplaces.name: Wayanad
touristplaces.origin: A district in North Kerala, known for its natural beauty and wildlife
touristplaces.specialty: Famous for waterfalls, wildlife sanctuaries, and scenic trekking routes

touristplaces.name: Thekkady
touristplaces.origin: Famous for the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary
touristplaces.specialty: Known for wildlife sightings, boating in the Periyar Lake, and spice plantations

touristplaces.name: Amber Fort
touristplaces.origin: Built in the 16th century by Raja Man Singh I
touristplaces.specialty: A massive fort made with red sandstone and marble, featuring stunning architecture and panoramic views

touristplaces.name: Hawa Mahal
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1799 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh
touristplaces.specialty: The Palace of Winds, known for its unique honeycomb-like structure with 953 windows

touristplaces.name: Udaipur City Palace
touristplaces.origin: Built in the 16th century by Maharana Udai Singh II
touristplaces.specialty: A grand palace overlooking Lake Pichola, known for its architecture and serene surroundings

touristplaces.name: Jaisalmer Fort
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1156 by Maharawal Jaisal Singh
touristplaces.specialty: A golden fort made of yellow sandstone, it is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the largest living forts in the world

touristplaces.name: Pushkar Lake
touristplaces.origin: A sacred lake with a history that dates back thousands of years
touristplaces.specialty: Famous for its religious significance and the annual Pushkar Camel Fair

touristplaces.name: Mehrangarh Fort
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1459 by Rao Jodha
touristplaces.specialty: A massive hilltop fort with stunning views of Jodhpur, known for its architecture and history

touristplaces.name: Gateway of India
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1924 to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary to India
touristplaces.specialty: Iconic symbol of Mumbai, features a blend of Hindu, Muslim, and Western architectural styles

touristplaces.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus
touristplaces.origin: Built in 1887 as a railway station, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
touristplaces.specialty: Victorian Gothic architectural masterpiece, an important heritage landmark

touristplaces.name: Marine Drive
touristplaces.origin: Constructed in the 1920s
touristplaces.specialty: Famous promenade offering spectacular views of the Arabian Sea, also known as the 'Queen's Necklace' at night

touristplaces.name: Elephanta Caves
touristplaces.origin: Dating back to the 5th to 8th centuries
touristplaces.specialty: Rock-cut caves dedicated to Hindu gods, including a large sculpture of Lord Shiva

touristplaces.name: Juhu Beach
touristplaces.origin: Popular beach destination
touristplaces.specialty: Famous for street food, beach sports, and sunset views

touristplaces.name: Taj Mahal Palace Hotel
touristplaces.origin: Opened in 1903, a historic luxury hotel
touristplaces.specialty: Famous for its architectural splendor and views of the Gateway of India

touristplaces.name: Dharavi Slum
touristplaces.origin: Established in the 19th century
touristplaces.specialty: One of the largest slums in Asia, offers a unique perspective on urban poverty and local industries

touristplaces.name: Coorg
touristplaces.origin: A popular hill station known for its coffee plantations
touristplaces.specialty: Coffee estates, waterfalls like Abbey Falls, and beautiful landscapes
